PROFESSIONAL ENGINEER CERTIFICATION OF NOTED STRUCTURAL ITEMS
L.S. DESROCHES 100224482
March 17 2025
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
NOTES:
PREPARATION:
1. REMOVE ALL TOPSOIL AND ORGANIC MATERIAL FROM THE BUILDING AREA.
2. BACKFILL TO BE CLEAN GRANULAR MATERIAL, FREE OF ORGANIC MATERIAL.
3. COMPACT FILL IN 8" LIFTS TO 98% S.P.D.
4. IF UNSUITABLE SOIL CONDITIONS ARE ENCOUNTERED, NOTIFY ENGINEER.
5. ALL FOOTINGS TO BEAR ON UNDISTURBED NATIVE SOIL OR COMPACTED FILL.
6. FOOTINGS TO BE MINIMUM 4'-0" BELOW FINISHED GRADE.
7. CONCRETE TO BE 25 MPa AT 28 DAYS.
8. REINFORCEMENT TO BE 10M BARS AT 12" O.C. EACH WAY.
9. PROVIDE 3" MINIMUM COVER TO ALL REINFORCEMENT.
10. ALL CONCRETE TO BE CURED FOR A MINIMUM OF 7 DAYS.
pages.page_overview_summary: This sheet presents the foundation plan for a 2-storey garage, including a typical edge detail. The plan outlines the dimensions and layout of the foundation, with notes on preparation and concrete specifications. Key components include the foundation slab and edge details, with specific instructions for soil preparation and concrete curing.

pages.general_notes_verbatim:
P.T. RATING:
CSA UC1: INDOOR WOOD NOT IN CONTACT WITH GROUND OR FOUNDATIONS
CSA UC2: INDOOR WOOD NOT IN CONTACT WITH GROUND OR FOUNDATIONS BUT EXPOSED TO DAMPNESS
CSA UC3: OUTDOOR WOOD NOT IN CONTACT WITH GROUND BUT PROTECTED AGAINST WEATHER OR WETTING
CSA UC4: WOOD IN CONTACT WITH GROUND OR FRESHWATER
pages.page_overview_summary: The main floor plan for the 2-storey garage is detailed on this sheet, showing the layout and dimensions of the ground floor. Key components include the steel beam layout and various structural elements. The plan includes notes on pressure-treated wood ratings and specifications for different environmental exposures.
